newsitem.title: CHINA: China agribank Jan-Sept farm loans up 37 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: China agribank Jan-Sept farm loans up 37 pct yr/yr.

text.p: The Agricultural Bank of China's farm loans from January to September rose by 37 percent to 116.4 billion yuan ($14 billion) compared with the same year-ago period, the Financial News said on Wednesday.
The bank gave out 113.1 billion yuan in loans to rural and township enterprises in the first nine months, up 39 percent compared with the year-ago period, the newspaper said.

More than 10 billion yuan of the loans had gone to help farms and enterprises to recover from devastating floods and other natural disasters that struck large areas of China earlier this year, the newspaper said.
A portion of the funds had been used to purchase secondary agricultural products, it said, adding that 3.4 billion yuan had been spent on buying sugar. It gave no further details.
